column11: Review Text
A truly peaceful location with fresh air, greenery, and beautiful views. Riverston is ideal for a calm and relaxing getaway.

column8: Breathtaking views at Riverston Viewpoint & Tower üåÑ
column11: Just visited the Riverston Viewpoint and Tower during my stay at Riv Eco Villa, and wow, what a spot! A short hike to the top rewards you with sweeping panoramic views over the Knuckles mountain range, lush valleys, and distant peaks. The tower gives an extra boost to the scenery, perfect for photos and a bit of quiet reflection. Easily one of the most picturesque spots in the region. Don‚Äôt miss it! üåø Leave No Trace ‚Äì Take only memories, leave only footprints. Please carry your trash back and help protect the beauty of Knuckles for future trekkers.

column8: Embracing the Misty Charm of Riverstone
column11: Visiting Riverstone was a fantastic experience, especially with the breathtaking mist that added a magical touch to the surroundings. However, things can get a bit tricky and exhausting if it starts to rain, so make sure to come prepared with an umbrella. The combination of natural beauty and unpredictable weather makes it an adventure worth having!

Riverston is a beautiful natural destination located in the central highlands of Sri Lanka, known for its scenic landscapes, cool climate, and biodiversity. It's a popular spot for nature lovers, hikers, and those looking to escape the heat of the lowlands. Some of the key attractions and features of Riverston include:

Riverston is a view point in the Raththota-Illukumbura-Hettipola road which offers breathtaking views if you make the trip in the right season. The main road is not in the best of conditions, but passable even by a low ground clearance vehicle. It is relatively narrow. But two vehicles can pass through in most places. It can get congested during long weekends and during the season and you might end up in long traffic jams. To reach the peak/ point known as "riverston" you have to park the vehicle on the side of the road and take a small hike on a tarred road. Parking is limited and it's one reason for the traffic jams on crowded days. We went in June, i.e in the off season, and the title summarizes our experience of riverston!  It was covered in mist the whole day, the mist also carried a lot of water and there was quite heavy winds. On the plus side, this meant that the temperature remained below 20c the whole day. Otherwise I believe it could have been  quite a hot climb during the season. The round trip of the hike took us about 45 mts despite the quite strong winds, a small drizzle and poor visibility. But the path was quite clear and spacious. We did notice one hiker having a problem with leeches but it was probably because she was wearing slippers. Nevertheless it would be a good idea to keep to the tarred path, away from the grass and wear covered shoes. We always apply excessive amounts of Siddhalepa on our shoes and feet where ever we hike which has always worked for us. You to purchase a ticket from the entrance for locals it was around LKR 75 per person if I remember correctly. We loved our off season experience. The only downside was that the wind was also quite loud and continued throughout the night and most of the day. It was even loud enough to keep us awake at night. But that was probably because our hotel was only 1km away from riverston. The wind and mist was there only at the high point near riverston. It would dissipate as soon as you pass it, both towards raththota and illukumbuta side. This route also offers you many other attractions like bambarakiriella waterfall (before you get to riverston), pitawala pathana, sera ella waterfall, a bathing spot in the Thelgamu river and the Kalu ganga reservoir dam. This road now goes all the way up to Giradurukotte, crossing a new bridge over Mahaweli river, spanning over vastly different climates and terrains. The drive itself a wonderfully scenic experience despite the not so ideal road conditions.

column8: Mini World's End, located near Riverston in Sri Lanka
column11: It sounds like you're describing the Pitawala Pathana viewpoint, known as Mini World's End, located near Riverton in Sri Lanka. Here's some more information. Mini World's End: This nickname refers to the dramatic cliff-edge viewpoint at Pitawala Pathana. It offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area, similar to the famous World's End viewpoint in Horton Plains National Park but on a smaller scale.

Located approximately 30 km from the Matale town, when travelling on Matale ‚Äì Girandurukotte road, rather windy with quite a few hairpins turns but in good condition, offers great views all around with a mini worlds end, lot less travelled by main stream tourists. Climatic conditions here are very similar to Horton plains with the addition of having two great waterfalls ‚ÄúSera Ella‚Äù and ‚ÄúBambarakiri Ella‚Äù, both of which are a site for sore eyes, don‚Äôt forget to relax on the rock seats of ‚ÄúSera Ella‚Äù relishing the cold misty spray of water on your face and Thelgamu Oya offers a great site for a dip in crystal clear but chilly water.

Nice place with breathtaking views of knuckles mountain range . you can take a 15-20 min walk at pitawala pathana to the cliff with a great view. need to buy tickets at the information center to visit the pitawala pathana.

column8: One of the most magical places in Sri Lanka
column11: Just pristine untouched part of the country. Lots to see and great for avid hikers and nature lovers.
Hiked to many parts of Riverston which was a breath of air at each turn. I'd suggest traveling with a known and experienced guide. Camping is a great way of enhancing the overall experience.

You can reach to the starting point of this hike from Mathale town by vehicles. There are enough parking spaces here. There are a few small joints selling snacks and drinks here. To reach the mountain top where telecom towers situated, you have to walk about 2km. It'll take about an hour to reach the top. There's nothing much to see other than the surrounding mountains or abandoned telecom towers. The area is bit cold. The road is clear and there are steps to reach the peak.
There are lot of beautiful waterfalls ,streams .In the night we can see nice sky,jungle.Very silence nice environment .
Who love reach bio diversity then visit knuckles mountain range . there are many thing to do and see

The environment of riverston is really great and you will be amazed about the bio diversity is there . weather is there changes so often and rain can fall anytime and wind is so powerful . this hike is around 3-4 km to top of  this mountain . The peak is above the cloud level . It's so beautiful 360 view in the clear day . You have to beware from leeches .Don't step jungle side ,just use the regular path. in heavy windy day have to carefully hike .

One of the coolest location in Matale. No vehicles only by foot and you will never feel tired because of the cool environment and the spectacular view. If you are a traveler this is one of the must visit location. You will see how wonderful the area is by looking at my picture. ‚ÄúVisit Sri Lanka‚Äù

It was a sudden trip. It took nearly 2.5hrs to reach there from Kandy. I used GPS to find the root. It was easy. Here you have a hike around 1.5hrs up to the cold freezing Riverston point. You can enjoy the walk. No tickets needed to enter. Unfortunately the view point was closed down due to some construction reasons. Root is very safe for someone who travels alone. Because there will always be people climbing up or coming down. you can enjoy the nature a lot. The mist, breeze, greens and with everything it feels like a way to heaven. Prefer to bring a coat, cap or something to cover up as the climate is always wet and drizzling. prefer comfortable walking shoes. don't go to the bushes or to the grass there are leeches waiting to hang on you. üòÅ Anyone can complete this hike. There is NO wild animal hazard around here. prefer to visit there during day time.

Great in both rainy and dry season. So many mountains to climb and water ways to bath. Windy in the dry season, but most of the water paths and waterfalls are drained. Still you can enjoy the hikes and the scenery. Access road itself is beautiful. Recently build villas are available for lodging at reasonable prices. Not crowded by terrorists.
Hiking here is a life time experience and not much difficulty thing, Don't miss if you visiting mathale

Riverston is one of the tourist attraction in Knuckles world heritage area. It also called as Riverston Gap and there is a small mountain to climb. When you reach Transmission tower there is a foot path and after you reach there can see the valley below. It is one of the breathtaking view which I saw in my life. Many miss the opportunity to see it and in the end you can feel the two climate ranges in one area. There is mountain range surrounded by beautiful valley in the gap and beaware of your steps.
If you are a nature lover this a place that you don't want to miss. need not to mention about the beauty just visit there and enjoy the great landscape

First Night was an adventerous Stay at Naturee River Cottage at Mahalakotuwa,Such a peaceful and lonely place sorrounded by the Forest and the shadow of Rawana.s Tarmac,famous Maniangala rock. Second day started with a visit to Famous Seralla Water fall and a bath at Thelgamu Oya .With Fish bites {Not about eating fishes but fishes trying to take us for bites]. And back to the Famous Sir Johns Bungalow,The paradise of Nature lovers.

Riverstan is most beautiful place to visit..no words to tell about beauty of the nature..wow virgin forests.. I am falling love with that place..hope I can have a small cottage to living there.. üòò if your are a nature lover,that is the great place to visit... you can feel your life.. you'r soul with that wind...wowww...amazing...üå∑üçÅüçÉüçÇüåøüçÄüåæüå≤üå¥üå≥üåºüåûüåù‚õÖ‚òÅüåà
Amazing ,Beautiful place in Sri Lanka.We can see many wonderful sceneries from here.Beautiful mountains,waterfalls & natural beauty of Sri Lanka.You should visit this place.

Although its not a difficult hike the sight you will gain is amazing . As this is situated in the high lands of Sri lanka throughout the year it will cover with the mist, It is good if you can visit there in summer. You will find many endemic plants and animals. Dont forget to visit PITAWALA pathana which is next to riverstan.

Sera ella water fall is nearly 12 km from the decent of peak location of Riverstan. From the main road you need to turn off and drive for nearly 12 km where the last 1.5 km is a rugged road, ideal for an SUV. This is one of the most unique and beautiful water falls of Sri lanka I have ever seen. The unique feature is that you can go behind the fall fall and watch the water falling by standing on the rock plate. Th pool of water which falls is not suitable for bathing as it may be dangerous but the pool itself is extremely beautiful with forest cover around the pool as well as the water fall. THOUGH DURING THE DRY SEASON THERE IS LESS WATER, DURING THE MONSOONS, it gives a beautiful sheet of water to make it panoramic. The trip to Rivestan itself is beautiful with all Knukles mountain ranges surrounding you. If you happen to go up to riverstan , you should not miss a visit to Sera ella. Instead of turning back  it would be advantageous for you to decend thrugh Luggala  down to Mahiyangana, have a look at the beautiful tank "Sora bora wewa" and return the following day.
